column4: how can i find a changelog for the new hardy-proposed generic kernel?  I want to see if anything's been done to the rtl8187 driver
lemme check...i can't find a compilable version of that driver, however--wondering if i'm missing a library--although i predict it's just crappy code...
not that i'm criticizing the devs
that's the rumor, but there are others out there--nothing on the rtl-wifi forums on compile failure, however (hosted on sf)
looks like the current rtl-wifi svn tree has something called "rtl8180-migration-for-upstream" and "rtl8180-sa2400-dev", which means to me that it's borked
based on the fact it's still marked dev
why not 64-bit?  working great here, with certain hardware issues
and are you using a sound server?
any kind of changes change the boot order--it's nuts.
i noticed that, it was great
why not install it on a vfat partition
